name: Sinigang na Isda sa Miso (Fish Stew with Miso)
author: nadette
summary: This is a popular Filipino soup dish usually eaten for lunch with rice. Several variations of this soup dish abound in the Philippines. However, I suggest that the green chiles should never be excluded.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons miso paste, or more to taste
1 teaspoon patis (fish sauce), or to taste
3  green chile peppers, or more to taste
1 bunch Chinese mustard greens with stalks
2 tablespoons kalamansi (Filipino lemon) juice, or more to taste
directions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat
Add onion, garlic, and ginger; cook and stir until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes
Add tomatoes; cook and stir until mushy, about 5 minutes
Stir in miso paste and fish sauce; simmer until flavors combine, about 2 minutes
Pour water into the pot; bring to a boil
Add fish fillets and radish; simmer until radish softens slightly, about 2 minutes
Stir in chile peppers,  , and kalamansi juice
Simmer, uncovered, until greens are wilted, 1 to 2 minutes
